Your hand suddenly becomes the dominant one as you enclose his in your own, giving him a gentle squeeze of his fingers — a symbolic gesture that you’re always here for him.

“I’m sure he’s up there laughing at us,” you return the smile, knowing that Robin’s sense of humour would be at the forefront of this situation. You raise Harry’s hand to your lips, brushing them mindfully across his knuckles.

Harry scoffs, “I promised him I wouldn’t fuck up and that I’d look after everyone around me. Now look at me, eh? Not even two years on and I’ve already broken that promise,” he whimpers at his own words. “I just seem to be fucking everything up as of late,” he trembles, wiping away at the tear that escapes in the hope that you don’t notice.

“Don’t do this to yourself, Harry, please,” you beg that he’s not harsh on himself at a difficult time. “I know I haven’t exactly made it easy telling you how I feel,” you say. “For me and you to ever be in a relationship — the complexity of it,” you stutter, unsure of how to approach the subject, “It just can’t happen for us. It wouldn’t be fair on you. You want to travel the world, make music and tour. Me? I’m just plain and simple and boring —”

“You’re not —” Harry attempts to cut you off but the threatening stare he receives from you as a warning — albeit jokingly — is enough to scold him for interrupting you.

“I just want to settle down. I’m ready for my life to move forwards,” you tell him with integrity.

“Christ, you sound like Gemma,” he jokes, although he’s had the immediate realisation of just how mature the young women in his life are actually becoming. “I’m kidding,” he smirks, and you’re only too appreciative that Harry — despite his glossy red rimmed eyes — seems to have regained a sense of humour and happiness. He sighs heavily before leaning forwards, resting his forehead against your own and resting his free hand on your knee, caressing your skin.

Butterflies flutter in your tummy at the close contact, your hot breaths fanning over each other’s faces. Anxiousness is at the forefront of your emotions, and you can’t help but feel a little disquieted as you consider the possibility that Harry will get your hopes up, only for you to be let down again by the same boy who appears before you.

The concept makes the metaphorical insects within you plummet to the pits of your stomach, the constant ache inside of you bubbling away and overpowering your sentiment. You’re not sure you could overcome rejection if it arose after the day’s intimacy between the two of you, the idea alone soul destroying.

You moisten your lips with your tongue, before quivering underneath his clement touch. “Harry, I can’t —” you mutter softly, closing your eyes. You quickly swing your legs over the edge of the bed, pulling your hand away from his before standing from the spot you had been sat and pacing into the centre of your bedroom.

“You can’t what, eh?” he asks gently, his voice encouraging as he follows suit, close behind your frame. His eyes, filled with sympathy and empathy, watch you diligently from behind, as you fold your arms protectively across your chest. “What can’t ya do, darling?” his thick accent resounds once more.

Your body instinctively twitches the moment his hand makes contact with your waist from behind you, his fingertips gently dancing on your hip. Despite the small flinch, you don’t move away from Harry, and instead, you welcome his affectionate touch. You stare down at your naked feet — your nails painted a baby pink shade from the BarryM Under the Sea collection — twiddling the soft circular rug, which lies beneath your skin, between your toes. Composing yourself, you turn around to face the taller boy, his bottom lip pulled between his teeth as he looks down at you.

“‘m sorry,” you whisper softly.

Brushing a strand of hair away from your hair, he shakes his head. “Don’t apologise. We’re both feeling pretty defensive right now, a lot’s happened,” he states. A momentary silence fills the tiny gap between you, before he finally plucks up the courage to express his desires. “I want to try something, darling,” he begins, a little hesitantly. “I’d like to try,” he repeats, “if you’ll let me.”

You nod, your body anticipating the next move the moment Harry’s right hand makes contact with your jawline, his palm cupping your face as his thumb skims your cheekbone, his soothing gesture hoping that you’ll relax in his embrace.

“’s just me yeah?” he reminds you softly, yearning to rid you of any apprehension in the potentially awkward encounter. “Your Harry.”

He’s the first to lean in towards you, eyelids fluttering closed as his plush lips make contact with your trembling ones. Encouraging you closer towards him, he places his left hand on the small of your back and pulls your frame tentatively towards him, not forcing you into anything you don’t feel comfortable with.

It’s your next action that’s the proof he needs. Your once clammy hands make contact with Harry, one snaking around the back of his neck as your thumb finds the sensitive spot behind his ear, making light work behind it as you stroke it gently. The other finds itself fisting through his hair, gently tugging at the curls at the nape of his neck. With a gentle tug of his locks, he moans into you, and he wonders how on earth he was able to deprive himself of this heaven for such a long time.

It’s your turn to vocalise your gratification with a soft groan into his mouth as his hands caress your skin, passion ignited within you both. His lips form a narcissistic smile against yours as he realises that he’s working you up. You feel giddy, like an inexperienced teenager having her seven minutes in heaven with her crush.

But you’re with Harry, and his delicate touch and passionate kiss reminds you that whilst he’ll lead you into this, you’re the one in control of the situation, and you’re always safe with him. Your lips greedily steal more kisses from him, his seemingly readily available for you. Each one becomes deeper as your tongues attempt to dominate each other’s.

The sweet taste of him lingers on your tongue, along with a hint of saltiness — a mixture of both of your tears — as his hot breath fans over you throughout the affectionate embrace. A moan leaves his mouth in disappointment when you pull away breathlessly, your glossy eyes gazing up at him.

“I’d like to do that more often,” he pulls his face away and smiles down at you, not once losing body contact as his thumb continues to skim your cheek. “Only if you want me to,” he continues.

Your giggly reply is the only confirmation he needs, “I always want you to.”

“That means you lied to me,” he smirks.

You reply with a frown, your lips pouting as you display your confusion at his comment, whilst your fingertips continuously stroke the nape of his neck.

“You said nobody would kiss me with lips like these,” he leans towards you and murmurs tauntingly close against your mouth, his lips dancing above your own once again.

“Shut up and kiss me, H,” you whimper, hungrily stealing another kiss from him.

“Love you,” he murmurs breathlessly between kisses. “Love you — I love you, I love you,” he repeats.

With his pants becoming breathier, you fight the internal battle of wanting him to tell you how much you mean to him, and needing the actions to follow up with his sincerity, and instead you settle on your audacious remark, begging him, “So show me you love me, then.”

trail.content_raw:
Hey everyone! This was one of my requests from the list of prompts I reblogged earlier this week. It was supposed to be a prompt but this has actually turned into an 8K bestfriend!harry one shot,  based on the angsty, “I can’t remember why I ever loved you.” Hopefully it’s enough angst but you know I can’t make Harry a complete dickhead! So we also feature fluff — like Easter chicks and bunnies, because it’s that time of year again!

Please remember that feedback is always welcomed!

Also, Happy Easter to anyone celebrating — and if you’re not celebrating, then I hope you have a lovely weekend, however you plan to spend it — and enjoy the chocolate eggs because you know, chocolate!

Cookie Monsters and Easter Bunnies.

“What the hell was that all about?” you ask incredulously, your burgundy Vans thundering heavily underneath your running legs and against the concrete as you chase after Harry into the car park of The Old Red Lion.

Visiting Harry and his family in Holmes Chapel had been a tradition for as long as you could remember when it came to birthdays, and Anne’s birthday this year had been no different. With a table booked at the local Ember Inns - an authentic pub which prides itself in serving traditional British classics, affordable wines and ales, along with it’s roaring log fires which welcome guests into the homely environment - a small gathering of family and close friends of Anne’s had been invited to join the birthday celebrations.

You had arrived in Harry’s childhood hometown a few hours prior to the event to spend some quality time with your best friend and his family. Yet, you couldn’t fathom how he had behaved so unpredictably towards you throughout the course of the evening.

“Harry, will you at least have the decency to look at me when I’m talking to you!” your voice suddenly booms into the night air as you follow closely behind the large male figure.

His footsteps instantly ease the moment you shout at him, his ears pricking up at your warning tone and his body immediately halting. Harry had never known you to shout - not at him, at least - within your years of close friendship. Slowly turning on his heel, he meets your gaze, only to be met with your teary eyes and a silence filling the space between you both.

“Well?” he eventually asks, licking his lips.

“Is that it?” you ask breathlessly, your chest heaving slightly as you shudder.

“What do you want me to say?” he asks, nonchalantly, shrugging his shoulders.

“You’ve barely spoken to me all night, H,” you tell him, sadly.

“I asked you how you are, I asked how work is for ya,” he begins, pouting his bottom lip and scuffing his shoes against the concrete of the car park that you’re undoubtedly about to have a disagreement in — because based on his attitude towards you, and you lacking the knowledge of why the sudden change in his behaviour, it’s inevitable that at least one of you is going to be left heartbroken tonight.

“Yeah, and that’s all you’ve said,” you whisper. “You haven’t spoken to me in weeks, Harry. You came back to London for a few weeks before disappearing off the face of the earth again-”

“I went to LA,” he clarifies gently.

“— and you never bothered to message me?” you ask, pulling the sleeves of your cardigan down over your thumbs before wrapping it around your shivering frame — you’re not sure if it’s a defence mechanism or if you are genuinely cold.

“My life doesn’t revolve around you!” he half yells.

“I know that,” you gulp, swallowing the lump in your throat.

“Then why are you acting as if me not contacting you is a big deal?” he asks, running his hands through his hair, tugging at the curls at the nape of his neck in frustration at how, unintentionally, disastrous the evening has played out.

“This isn’t even just about you not contacting me. You’ve been so flaky with me tonight and I don’t even know why! You’re my best friend, Harry, and you can barely string together two words and talk to me. I didn’t even hear it from you that you were back in London a few weeks ago,” you cry.

“I was busy,” he sighs, excusing his recent lack of communication.

“So I saw,” you tell him.

“What the hell is that supposed to mean?” he scoffs.

“I know you’re busy, H,” you begin, nodding your head in understanding at his situation regarding his fame, “but seeing the media posting pictures and articles of you meeting up with people, it’s hard. You mean to tell me that you couldn’t at least spare five minutes of your time to drop me a text to tell me you were home? You mean you were too busy to come and see me?”

Since arriving back home to London, Harry had been sighted in North London pubs with a string of high profile celebrities, including the CEO of Sony. You were none the wiser as to whether these well-known males in the public eye were just friends of Harry’s, or if they were involved in helping him achieve success with his upcoming album.

“Just like you couldn’t spare five minutes of your time to drop me a text and tell me you were going on a date?” he attempts to bite back, but his voice fails him as the harsh tone he strives for refuses to deliver. Instead, you’re met with his soft timbre, yet the hurt within his expression is enough to resonate into the autumn air.

“That —” you begin, struggling to form your words. The statement had caught you off guard, leaving you baffled. “This is what all of this has been about? You’re pissed off at me because I didn’t tell you I was going on a date?” you ask, the crease on your forehead becoming more prominent as you struggle to comprehend Harry’s emotions. “I would have told you in person, you know, when you were back in London, when I thought we’d actually see each other. Besides, there was nothing to tell —”

Harry’s quick to cut you off with a scoff and raised eyebrows. “Nothing to tell? Why are being so self-righteous? If I have to tell you everything that’s going on in my life, then surely you should be telling me everything you’re getting up to in yours?” he counter argues. “But instead, I find out through fans on Twitter that my best friend is hooking up with some random guy.”

You shrug your shoulders at his words, realising that perhaps he has a point. Whilst you find it devastating that you only know about Harry’s movements via social media, you hadn’t considered that maybe Harry feels equally as hurt when you don’t openly discuss things with him either. He’s your best friend, after all.

“I thought you’d have more important things to worry about,” you murmur softly.

“Like what?” he asks, awaiting your next answer.

Lowering your gaze to the ground, you gently chew your bottom lip, unsure of how to express yourself. Inhaling a deep breath, you continue, “Camille,” and your eyes squeeze shut at the sound of her name bitterly leaving your lips.

“So you’re jealous,” he states. It wasn’t a question and you both knew it.

You quickly shake your head, your heart thumping against your chest. “No, of course not.” The unwelcome taste of salt suddenly lingers on your lips and you know that the tears that had been threatening to spill over during your confrontation had done so. You only hoped Harry wouldn’t notice as you bring your hand up to rid your cheeks of the track marks they most likely left. “Why are you so bothered anyway? Why do you care who I’m dating?” you quickly attempt to change the topic of conversation.

“I’m not bothered,” he sneers. “I don’t give a shit who you’re fucking each week.”

You struggle to decipher what is being communicated, his words stabbing at your heart as he cheapens your experiences — or rather lack of — with the opposite gender. Unable to prevent your bottom lip from trembling, you let out a small sob at your best friend’s unrelenting words.

With glossy eyes and a shaky breath, you endeavour to maintain at least some dignity you may have within yourself as the conflict between the two of you persists. “What, are you jealous?” you bite back.

His disparaging smile speaks louder than words, but the remark that follows is one that resounds, “Don’t flatter yourself.” He spits his words venomously, cruelty expressed in his stance as he narrows his eyes at you.

“Fuck you,” you sob. “I’ve been there for you through everything, Harry! And this is how you repay me?” you cry. Disregarding the constant flow of tears from your red, blotchy cheeks with the back of your hand, you sigh heavily before taking a deep breath and continuing, “It’s been so hard without you being around the past few months, and I was really looking forward to seeing you tonight and spending time together. But now? I can’t remember why I ever loved you,” you whimper.

[[MORE]]

Your eyes instantly widen at your disclosure — in shock, fear, surprise, and you’re not even sure where the sudden declaration had come from. Your hidden feelings had never meant to be exposed — you dreamt most nights that you would both eventually be in a stable position in your lives where you could unselfishly confess your undying love for the boy in front of you. But this wasn’t what you had envisaged, and you hadn’t intended to overshadow Anne’s birthday celebrations. You were only too grateful that the other adults had pursued their night of revelry within the comfort of the quaint pub, none the wiser of the events occurring in Harry’s childhood village.

Perhaps the weight being lifted from deep within your heart had heightened your senses. A group of young men had drunkenly cheered, “Oi Oi,” at the revelation, a scene more common in a rom-com movie that Harry most likely owned a copy of. The smoke from their cigarettes in the designated area lingered in the October sky, and you knew that you would have to wash your hair at least twice before you no longer smell like a bonfire. Besides the jibes from the young adults loitering in the pub car park, the only other sound heard in Holmes Chapel was the eery ringing of the bells at St Luke’s Church behind you, and your heavy breathing, your hot breath forming a misty cloud before you.

“You —” Harry begins, scuffing the heel of his boot against the concrete as he places a hand on his hip, wetting his lips with his tongue, “— you love me?” he stammers.

“I —” you stutter, fingers fumbling around in your clutch bag until you find the car key you desire. Grasping it between your thumb and forefinger, you step back slightly, almost losing your balance in the process.

Harry whispers your name gently in the cold breeze, your name effortlessly rolling off his tongue as though any cruel words he had spoken prior to your revelation had diminished. “Darling?” he tries again with a pet name, his Cheshire dialect pronouncing the word you love hear him vocalise so much.

His effort at comforting you with his soft tone proves to be unsuccessful as you take advantage of the space between you and run from him, your car within only a few steps. Even under pressure and with trembling fingers, you’re able to unlock the door to the driver’s side and climb into the car, locking it behind you as you ignore Harry’s pleas, your mind blocking out the desperate call of your name whilst in pursuit of you.

“Fuck,” he mutters under his breath, running a hand through his hair as he watches you speed away from the pub — and indubitably from Holmes Chapel. He never wants you to run from him. Taking his bottom lip between his thumb and forefinger — a sign that he’s in deep thought — he’s left alone to ponder before reaching a decision that will affect his future.

* * *

Your hand firmly grips the handle of the Walt Disney Dumbo mug that houses your hot liquid as you trail up the stairs and back to your bedroom. Whilst recent events would be a satisfactory excuse to wallow, you didn’t want to waste your day off hiding underneath your duvet and pitying yourself.

Instead, you had taken to playing online games and watching ridiculously romantic movies, whilst simultaneously rearranging your iTunes folder. In other words, you were busying yourself with unnecessary and menial tasks, but it proved to be a welcomed distraction, at least.

It had been a week, a whole seven days, since you had confessed your love to Harry. As you had expected, you’d heard from him instantly upon your journey home — you’d received several messages on the same night following your declaration, requesting that you either come back to Holmes Chapel and talk things through with him, answer your phone, or at least respond to his messages so as he knows you’re safe. But since arriving back at your London home, it seemed as though Harry had given up all hope of contacting you.

Taking a sip of your hot chocolate, you inevitably smear whipped cream onto your nose, before placing the mug onto the coaster on your desk and seating yourself in the cushioned swivel chair. Tutting at the minor inconvenience, you wipe it away with the back of your hand before opening the lid to your computer and heading straight into the games section and loading your Sims family.

Beneath the cover of the chilly October skies, you took advantage of having the smallest bedroom window open onto the latch to allow fresh air to circulate the room. Your bedroom is aesthetically pleasing — the warm glow of a Yankee candle burning on your windowsill, the flickering flame reflecting against the darkness outside caused by the autumn season, and the battery powered moon phase fairy lights decorate the metal headboard of your bed, the small white lights displaying a warmth to your safe haven.

You’re so immersed in your game that a knock at the front door barely distracts you. Taking a glance at the clock, you note that whilst it’s not an unthinkable hour, you’re home alone and it’s dark outside. Only when the knocking becomes persistent do you remove yourself from the screen that’s providing you with the evening’s entertainment. You log out of your account, before sighing heavily as you trudge down the stairs.

Swinging the door open, you’re surprised as to who the uninvited guest standing in the doorway is. You blink in disbelief, before being the first to break the silence between you.

“What are you doing here, H?” you ask, wrapping your arms around your frame protectively. There’s a hint of annoyance in your voice at his unannounced visit, but sadness overpowers any other emotion that you’re internally battling as the boy who broke your heart stands before you.

“I’ve come to make amends,” he gives you a small smile, “if you’ll let me.”

You lower your gaze and chew your bottom lip gently, your eyes averting to his jewellery clad hand - his H and S Gucci rings dressing his fingers, expressing his narcissistic manner — yet you knew Harry better than anyone, and you would never describe him as a person who has excessive interest in himself.

The handle of a Tesco carrier bag is firmly within his hold and it warms your heart that even with his ever growing fame, he continues to carry out the dull task of high street shopping. “I bought cookies,” he smirks in an attempt to win you over, “with chocolate chips,” he clarifies, once he notices your gaze upon the bag he’s carrying.

You raise an eyebrow at him before frowning, pouting your lips ever so slightly. “What chocolate chips?” you dare to ask, suddenly realising that you sound like a five year old child having to be bribed by their parents to complete a household chore.

“White chocolate, ’f course,” his heart skipping a beat as a smile dances upon your lips — a smile that he had missed and desperately craved, especially after the agonisingly long week he’d experienced. “Only the best for my favourite girl.”

“I haven’t been your favourite girl for a few months now, Harry,” you murmur, your features etched with disappointment and sadness as you purse your lips together and avert your sad gaze towards the concrete step he stands on, Harry’s feet much too big for small paving slabs.

“Hey, hey doll, look at me,” his soft voice encourages you to maintain eye contact as his fingertips reach for your elbow.

The comforting action achieves it’s intention as your eyes scan his face. His boyish grin from only moments ago has disappeared and his expression is serious — apologetic. The slight tint of redness in his eyes is proof that he’s tired, perhaps having had the same amount of restless nights as you.

“You goin’ to let me in?” he pushes the conversation gently. “Because as much as I love the cold and rain, I don’t really fancy getting sick before the album release,” he smirks. “And I don’t want your cookies getting wet,” he adds, pouting his lips.

You nod, rolling your eyes, but the small smile that reappears on your lips is enough to display to Harry that you’re more than happy to have him within the comfort of your own home.

“You’re just in time, I made a hot chocolate. Do you want one?” you ask, as you step back and allow him to enter the narrow hallway of your home.

“So I can see,” he smirks, bopping your button nose with his forefinger. You mirror his expression as his playfulness displays itself, and he quickly licks the whipped cream, that he removed from the tip of your nose, off of his finger. “Silly question, really, ‘f course I’ll have one,” he laughs.

“Go on, go upstairs and I’ll bring it up,” you tell him.

Kicking off his boots and leaving them beside the front door, he quickly obliges to your request and heads upstairs, leaving you to head to the kitchen to cater for him. Whilst Harry was more than capable of looking after himself, a small part of you always felt a need to mother him.

Reaching for the mugs in the cupboard, you knowingly pull out the blue porcelain one with the famous Sesame Street Cookie Monster Muppet on it, along with the childhood classic expression, “Me want cookie! Om nom nom.” You know your sense of humour would be welcomed by him when he eats his white chocolate chip cookie whilst drinking out of the Cookie Monster mug you provide for him. Within only a few minutes, you had made the milky drink and you head upstairs with Harry’s hot chocolate.

“Here you go, cream and marshmallows, don’t say I never spoil you,” you hum softly as you enter your bedroom. You almost drop the mug at the sight of Harry sat in the padded swivel chair, exploring your online game. “Hey, that’s private!” you exclaim. You quickly place the mug down onto your wooden dresser, before reaching for the desktop mouse within Harry’s hand, removing it from his grip.

His boyish grin returns, paired with a laugh, before stating, “It’s not private if I know your password. Told ya before, lovie, you shouldn’t have the same password for everything, y’know.”

Giving you a wink, he stands from his spot, freeing the chair for you. Taking his mug of hot chocolate into his hands, he murmurs his gratitude to you before pacing to the other side of your bedroom and lowering himself onto your freshly made bed.

“We’re married, I see?” he asks rhetorically, raising an eyebrow as he nods towards your computer, referring to The Sims game you were previously playing prior to his unannounced arrival.

“We’re in the process of getting a divorce,” you murmur nonchalantly, as once again you log out of your account and focus your attention back to the young man — who seemed to make himself right at home propped up against the cushions with his legs outstretched — on your bed.

“Touché,” he replies, taking a sip of his hot liquid. “On what grounds?” he dares to ask, raising an eyebrow.

You shrug, “On the grounds that my husband accused me of fucking someone else every week,” and despite your voice being of a quiet tone, there was a hint of bitterness to your words, clearly establishing that you won’t forget some of Harry’s vicious comments in a hurry. “You can keep the kids,” you tell him. “We have two girls — they both have a very artistic side, can play the piano, and they enjoy swimming. They go to private school so are very academic. I’m keeping the dog, she’s a Golden Retriever and she’s pregnant,” you clarify. “And so am I, because we woo hoo’d a couple of weeks ago. Also, I have a date tonight,” you add, filling him in on your fantasy life.

The last comment nearly makes Harry spit the mouthful of hot chocolate out onto your crisp white bed sheets, his pulse raging, his blood boiling, and his heart thumping within his chest as he fears he may have to decipher the metaphorical terminology you’re potentially using.

He coughs, “and do you?” he asks. “I mean, do you have a date tonight?”

You shake your head. “No, not in real life,” you confirm.

Harry instantly relaxes — his chest is no longer puffed and his breathing slows once again, his once hunched over shoulders suddenly release their tension, and his ringed fingers which were momentarily curled into a fist, whilst resting on his knee, are now outstretched before him again.

The flickering light within his peripheral vision is enough to distract him from his thoughts — even if only for a short time — and his eyes avert to the window sill of your bedroom which is home to a Yankee Candle. However, with four of them in your bedroom readily available to light at any one time, he’s not sure how you make the tough decision of which scent you would like to indulge yourself in. It seemed that you were comforted by the Belgian Waffles aroma throughout the October nights, whilst Salt Mist Rose, Pink Sands, and Christmas Cookie take a back seat.

“How did —” he begins nervously, breaking the silence, “how did your date go?” he asks, placing his mug on the table beside him before leaning forwards ever so slightly at the sudden change of direction in conversation. He raises his left hand behind his head, resting the palm behind him as he subconsciously scratches the back of his head, simultaneously adjusting his right knee into an upright position.

You shrug, “I didn’t like it.”

There’s an element of worry and fear in Harry’s features, his brows furrowing, with creases appearing on the centre of his forehead. “What ‘appened? Do I need to kick his arse? Chop his bollocks off?” his British accent somewhat stronger when he curses.

You laugh at his protectiveness, surprised at how quickly you had fallen back into your accustomed routine of friendship despite recent events. “Nothing happened,” you ease his obvious anxiety with only two words. “He was a nice guy actually, we just didn’t click. It’s not my fault my heart’s not in it. Ironically, somebody else has my heart. I just tried ignoring those feels in the hope they would go away, not realising that they wouldn’t just disappear on their own,” you smile sadly, chewing your bottom lip.

Harry pouts, bringing a hand up towards his face, his thumb and forefinger make light work of his plush lips as he caresses the chapped skin that the recent cold and windy weather had been responsible for biting away at. You reach into the top drawer of your dresser, pulling out a chapstick.

“Here,” you murmur softly, standing from your spot and heading towards him. You hand him the cosmetic as you lower yourself onto your bed opposite him, cross legged as he takes the product into his larger hands and holds it at each end.

Swivelling it around within his loose grip, he reads aloud the words printed on the yellow lidded cylindrical object, “Nivea, milk and honey,” he murmurs. “Bit girly, init? Won’t do much for my masculinity,” he jokes with a small smile, but he removes the lid and applies the balm to his lips regardless.

“Well, nobody’s going to kiss you, not with lips like that,” you murmur softly as you watch him evenly spread the salve, moisturising his dry skin.

His brows continue to furrow with his intent focus on the tedious — yet simplest — task.

“You know, if you keep frowning like that, you’ll be left with worry lines,” you tell him, reaching up and delicately caressing his forehead with your soft fingertips. You immediately still at your gesture of close contact. “I’m sorry,” you breathlessly whisper, hastily removing your hand from his face and grabbing for the closest object within reach — Mr Bunny — in an attempt to put a literal barrier between the two of you.

Harry shakes his head, “Don’t apologise. I like being touched by you,” he murmurs softly. He reflects your posture, straightening his back and sitting upright, crossing his legs. Leaning forwards, he cautiously reaches for the hand you’d rapidly withdrawn from him and envelopes it within his own.

“Please, don’t. Don’t make it any harder than it already is,” you beg in a whimper at his intimate actions and affectionate words that would usually uplift your spirits and put you on cloud nine. Now, his utterances seem like empty promises and that would only threaten to break you down further, weakening the confidence you’d merely regained within the last few days.

It shatters Harry’s heart when you pull your fingers out of his hold, instead, averting your attention and caress to Mr Bunny’s long, floppy ears, your fingers twiddling with the off-white fluff of the stuffed animal sat securely within your lap.

“Didn’t I buy you this?” he asks with a small smile, his voice remarkably composed as he battled internally with the bubbling anger towards himself along with ] the hurt he was experiencing at your apparent rejection of his touch.

It was a statement as opposed to a question, Harry remembering with clarity the day he entered the Build-a-Bear Workshop in the shopping mall as it fast approached Easter only a year ago. He had chosen the bunny rabbit solitarily, shamelessly stuffing him — with love, quite literally, as the floor manager handed him a heart shape and requested he press a kiss to it before fitting it within the teddy — before printing off a birth certificate and choosing a wrist accessory — an Easter flower bouquet consisting of three coloured roses — pink, yellow, and purple.

“Yeah,” you laugh breathily, as he removes the soft toy from your lap and inspects it. “You know, most people buy their friend’s Easter eggs that time of year,” you smile up at him, meeting his gaze since the first time you’d willingly expressed your endearment towards him with the tender touch of your fingertips.

‘I did get you an Easter egg,” he cockily states with a smirk, simultaneously shrugging his shoulders whilst his hands cordially stroke the ears of the bunny now sat in his lap. “A Crunchie one, if I remember correctly,” he grins knowingly.

“You did get me a Crunchie one, but you bought me the teddy, too,” you state matter of factly, attempting to prove the point of his need to go excessively overboard regarding buying gifts for his loved ones for an array of occasions that he could find any reason to celebrate.

“It’s a rabbit,” he informs you.

“Same thing,” you dismiss.

“They’re actually not,” he mumbles softly. “Anyway, it was the flower bouquet as an accessory that made your smile burst into full bloom,” he beams, his boyish grin returning once again as he teases you. “You do love your teddies,” he notes, as he looks around your childhood bedroom.

Harry sought great comfort in the ordinary bedroom you possessed throughout your childhood. He had watched both you, and your living environment, mature with time. Your shelves displayed some of your most treasured possessions — photographs of yourself surrounded by the most important people in your life, and Harry was honoured to be included in the colour transparencies.

A star sign pot which housed your crystals stood on the same shelf — Harry couldn’t understand your obsession with crystals and if he was honest, he didn’t care that Obsidian, Quartz, Jasper and Moonstone possessed qualities inclusive of — but not limited to — healing, strength, wisdom, and protection, nor did he know the difference between the stones, but it’s clear they serve an importance in your life as he notes that the pot is paired with a book titled, The Little Book of Crystals, which he knows, with little to no doubt, that it is a quirky Urban Outfitters purchase.

“I’m sorry,” Harry suddenly murmurs, and his apologetic tone encourages you to both make eye contact with each other. “I’ve been a total dickhead,” he admits, pouting before licking his lips, wetting the dry skin. He looks up, eyes finding the ceiling before he squeezes them shut. “We should talk about what happened,” his words resonate within your bedroom.

As he regains his courage and looks back down at you, he’s met with your glossy eyes, tears threatening to spill over as the confrontation you dreaded has finally materialised.

“Please don’t cry,” he whispers softly, his fingertips dancing on your knee as you remain cross legged before him. Your name rolls facilely off of his tongue. “You know I hate seeing you cry,” he adds with complete integrity.

Harry places Mr Bunny beside him on the bed before reaching for the box of tissues on the bedside table. He instantly notices the novel, Turtles All the Way Down, accompanied by the turtle ornament he had bought for you following his visit to Jamaica, after having written and produced the first self-titled album. The attention to detail in your bedroom tugged at his heartstrings fractionally more as he realises that there’s something so reassuring about the consistency you offer him when he returns home.

“Thanks,” you murmur gratefully through your tears as you reach for a piece of the material. Removing a tissue from the box, you scrunch it into a ball before wiping away the streaky track marks that had stained your red cheeks.

“I need you to be honest with me, angel. How long have you felt like this?” he asks, gently pushing the topic.

Taking a deep and shaky breath, you reply with your answer. “A while,” you whimper as your chest heaves and your body shudders, your breathing become a little more erratic as your sobs increase.

“Hey, hey, doll, it’s just me,” he murmurs softly, raising a hand to your cheek and resting his palm against you. “It’s just me, init,” he repeats his comforting statement as you seek reassurance from him, nuzzling your face into him as his thumb skims the salty tears on your skin. “It’s Harry, your Harry,” he confirms.

“But you’re not my Harry,” you quiver against his touch at your own words.

“I decide who I do and don’t belong to, and right now, I’m telling you that I’m your Harry,” he states simply. “Is this about what you said the other night? About me seeing Camille?” he asks. His suspicions are confirmed when the unmistakable look of hurt lingers in your eyes, far too long for his liking. “Fuck,” he mutters under his breath, “fuck, doll, she’s just a friend.”

“I’ve heard that before,” you tell him, a slight scoff emitting from your lips as you roll your eyes.

“I don’t love her,” he tells you firmly.

“H,” you sigh.

“No,” his voice is adamant, “I don’t love her,” he repeats with confidence.

“It doesn’t matter if you do, Harry, you can’t help who you fall for,” you assure him.

“Fuck — will you just listen!” he exclaims, running a hand frustratedly through his hair as he stands up from his position, pacing the wooden floor of your bedroom, clearly agitated at how the situation before him is playing out. “I don’t love Camille because —” he pauses, running a hand over his face, before turning back to you, “because I fucking love you!” he cries, gesturing towards you.

A deafening silence, paired with a suddenly uncomfortable atmosphere, surrounds you both, almost as though creating a barrier between the two of you. The howling of a harsh gust of wind rattles the garden fences that segregate yourself from your neighbours, and the rain lashing against at the glass panes of your windows are the only signs of life around you.

“I’m in love with you, sweetheart,” he murmurs softly, as he resumes his position on the bed opposite you, mirroring your demeanour. “Please say something,” he practically begs, as he reaches for your hand once more, his thumb skimming your fingers and he breathes a noticeable sigh of relief when you don’t flinch at the contact.

“You — you love me?” you ask in disbelief.

He nods, pulling his bottom lip between his teeth. “Yeah,” he breathes.

“How — how long?” you ask, shocked.

He curls his hand into a fist, coughing lightly to clear his throat. “About two years, roughly,” he replies.

You frown, your brows creasing as you mentally put together the pieces of the jigsaw puzzle you envisage, revisiting two years worth of friendship and trying desperately to discover where along the line his feelings for you had developed further.

“No, no, Harry, you must be confused,” you mutter softly, shaking your head, almost refusing to believe his declaration of being in love with you. “You can’t —” you begin, “— you can’t be in love with me.”

“I’m not —” he sighs, angry, feeling defeated as you have difficulty in understanding his feelings towards you. “I’m not confused, I just — I know how I feel!” he exclaims, frustratedly. “I’ve been in love with you for two years! I was just too self absorbed, focusing on the album to act on anything I felt, and then I had people around me trying to set me up with high profile celebrities —”

“Models,” you clarify, your expression pained.

He shakes his head, “Look, it doesn’t matter who, ok,” he tells you.

Pausing, his eyes find the ceiling once more as he contemplates how to express himself, words wrestling with each other as they swim around his mind. He struggles to comprehend vocalising his feelings, before attempting his honesty once more.

“I’m sorry it took me this long to tell you,” he apologises, opening his eyes to make contact with yours. “I’m a coward because I couldn’t admit my feelings. I just — I can’t be selfish with you, darling.”

“Selfish?” you question with caution. “Harry, you’re the least selfish person I know,” you assure him.

“Ruining our friendship would have been selfish of me,” he shakes his head. “Drawing you into a lifestyle like mine would be selfish. I can’t drag you into a world — my world,” he closes his hurt filled eyes for a second before continuing, “ — of publicity and judgement on everything you do. It chews you up and spits you out, and that’s not a life I would promise to anyone I’m in a relationship with, especially not you.”

You nod, understanding his impassioned process of thinking.

“Like you, I hoped that these feelings would just go away too — and when they didn’t —” he pauses, his expression guilty as he struggles to maintain eye contact with you before his admission, “I wished that you would go away instead. That’s why I started ignoring you and for that, I am really sorry,” he admits, biting at his bottom lip nervously.

“H —” you begin with a heavy sigh.

“Seeing you go on a date,” he begins, before clarifying, “It felt like someone was stabbing me in the heart twenty times over because I felt like you were moving forwards with your life and I was no longer a part of it,” he confesses. “I thought maybe my feelings for you had just resurfaced, but in reality, they never left.”

Once again, you nod before clarifying, “It was just a date, Harry. Nothing came of it.”

“I know,” he sighs. “But what if you really liked him? What if you were compatible with each other and everything went well? The next time I’d hear from you would be in two years when you’re getting married ‘nd you’re pregnant with his kid or somethin’,” he pouts.

“Now you’re just being silly,” you tut at the sudden change in direction of the conversation, Harry fast forwarding years into your life. “Do — do you really love me?” you dare to ask, still having difficulty in comprehending the massive curveball he had thrown tonight.

“Yeah,” he breathes. “Why is that so hard for you to understand?” he asks.

“Because —” you gulp, “because I’m nothing,” you shrug. “You could have any girl in the world —”

“I’m stopping you right there. I don’t want to listen to you belittle yourself. It’s not necessary, and anything bad you say about yourself isn’t true,” he tells you, firmly. “You’re — fuck me, doll, you’re perfect,” he breathes softly, squeezing your hand reassuringly.

You twiddle your fingers together, intertwining them in your lap as you chew your bottom lip, struggling with the compliments he’s paying you. You always found flattery difficult, unable to believe any sincere praise and admiration anyone has for you.

“It seemed that someone knew how you and I felt,” he smirks, before pursing his lips together and his eyes rolling towards the ceiling, a breathy laugh escaping his lips.

You blush at the revelation, your cheeks reddening as you become flustered in front of the boy you’d discussed your feelings with. You had never declared your feelings for Harry to any of his family, nor did you think you’d made your adoration for him obvious to anyone. A medley of reasons contributed to your hidden feelings — inclusive of embarrassment, being knowledgeable enough to realise you’re not Harry’s usual type, worry of not being good enough, fear of rejection, but most of all, the apprehension of losing a lifelong best friend.

“Robin knew,” he clarifies, in an attempt to ease your suddenly obvious anxious state.

“He was a wise man,” you tell him softly with a small nod of your head. A small lump forms at the base of your throat. Robin had been a trusting male figure in your life, and talking about Harry’s step-father was still a raw and emotional topic for everyone following his battle with cancer.

“He certainly was. If he could see us now, he’d probably bang our heads together,” he gives you a small smile but with his bottom lip trembling, you know he’ll likely reach breaking point within a short space of time. Your hand suddenly becomes the dominant one as you enclose his in your own, giving him a gentle squeeze of his fingers — a symbolic gesture that you’re always here for him.

“I’m sure he’s up there laughing at us,” you return the smile, knowing that Robin’s sense of humour would be at the forefront of this situation. You raise Harry’s hand to your lips, brushing them mindfully across his knuckles.

Harry scoffs, “I promised him I wouldn’t fuck up and that I’d look after everyone around me. Now look at me, eh? Not even two years on and I’ve already broken that promise,” he whimpers at his own words. “I just seem to be fucking everything up as of late,” he trembles, wiping away at the tear that escapes in the hope that you don’t notice.

“Don’t do this to yourself, Harry, please,” you beg that he’s not harsh on himself at a difficult time. “I know I haven’t exactly made it easy telling you how I feel,” you say. “For me and you to ever be in a relationship — the complexity of it,” you stutter, unsure of how to approach the subject, “It just can’t happen for us. It wouldn’t be fair on you. You want to travel the world, make music and tour. Me? I’m just plain and simple and boring —”

“You’re not —” Harry attempts to cut you off but the threatening stare he receives from you as a warning — albeit jokingly — is enough to scold him for interrupting you.

“I just want to settle down. I’m ready for my life to move forwards,” you tell him with integrity.

“Christ, you sound like Gemma,” he jokes, although he’s had the immediate realisation of just how mature the young women in his life are actually becoming. “I’m kidding,” he smirks, and you’re only too appreciative that Harry — despite his glossy red rimmed eyes — seems to have regained a sense of humour and happiness. He sighs heavily before leaning forwards, resting his forehead against your own and resting his free hand on your knee, caressing your skin.

Butterflies flutter in your tummy at the close contact, your hot breaths fanning over each other’s faces. Anxiousness is at the forefront of your emotions, and you can’t help but feel a little disquieted as you consider the possibility that Harry will get your hopes up, only for you to be let down again by the same boy who appears before you.

The concept makes the metaphorical insects within you plummet to the pits of your stomach, the constant ache inside of you bubbling away and overpowering your sentiment. You’re not sure you could overcome rejection if it arose after the day’s intimacy between the two of you, the idea alone soul destroying.

You moisten your lips with your tongue, before quivering underneath his clement touch. “Harry, I can’t —” you mutter softly, closing your eyes. You quickly swing your legs over the edge of the bed, pulling your hand away from his before standing from the spot you had been sat and pacing into the centre of your bedroom.

“You can’t what, eh?” he asks gently, his voice encouraging as he follows suit, close behind your frame. His eyes, filled with sympathy and empathy, watch you diligently from behind, as you fold your arms protectively across your chest. “What can’t ya do, darling?” his thick accent resounds once more.

Your body instinctively twitches the moment his hand makes contact with your waist from behind you, his fingertips gently dancing on your hip. Despite the small flinch, you don’t move away from Harry, and instead, you welcome his affectionate touch. You stare down at your naked feet — your nails painted a baby pink shade from the BarryM Under the Sea collection — twiddling the soft circular rug, which lies beneath your skin, between your toes. Composing yourself, you turn around to face the taller boy, his bottom lip pulled between his teeth as he looks down at you.

“‘m sorry,” you whisper softly.

Brushing a strand of hair away from your hair, he shakes his head. “Don’t apologise. We’re both feeling pretty defensive right now, a lot’s happened,” he states. A momentary silence fills the tiny gap between you, before he finally plucks up the courage to express his desires. “I want to try something, darling,” he begins, a little hesitantly. “I’d like to try,” he repeats, “if you’ll let me.”

You nod, your body anticipating the next move the moment Harry’s right hand makes contact with your jawline, his palm cupping your face as his thumb skims your cheekbone, his soothing gesture hoping that you’ll relax in his embrace.

“’s just me yeah?” he reminds you softly, yearning to rid you of any apprehension in the potentially awkward encounter. “Your Harry.”

He’s the first to lean in towards you, eyelids fluttering closed as his plush lips make contact with your trembling ones. Encouraging you closer towards him, he places his left hand on the small of your back and pulls your frame tentatively towards him, not forcing you into anything you don’t feel comfortable with.

It’s your next action that’s the proof he needs. Your once clammy hands make contact with Harry, one snaking around the back of his neck as your thumb finds the sensitive spot behind his ear, making light work behind it as you stroke it gently. The other finds itself fisting through his hair, gently tugging at the curls at the nape of his neck. With a gentle tug of his locks, he moans into you, and he wonders how on earth he was able to deprive himself of this heaven for such a long time.

It’s your turn to vocalise your gratification with a soft groan into his mouth as his hands caress your skin, passion ignited within you both. His lips form a narcissistic smile against yours as he realises that he’s working you up. You feel giddy, like an inexperienced teenager having her seven minutes in heaven with her crush.

But you’re with Harry, and his delicate touch and passionate kiss reminds you that whilst he’ll lead you into this, you’re the one in control of the situation, and you’re always safe with him. Your lips greedily steal more kisses from him, his seemingly readily available for you. Each one becomes deeper as your tongues attempt to dominate each other’s.

The sweet taste of him lingers on your tongue, along with a hint of saltiness — a mixture of both of your tears — as his hot breath fans over you throughout the affectionate embrace. A moan leaves his mouth in disappointment when you pull away breathlessly, your glossy eyes gazing up at him.

“I’d like to do that more often,” he pulls his face away and smiles down at you, not once losing body contact as his thumb continues to skim your cheek. “Only if you want me to,” he continues.

Your giggly reply is the only confirmation he needs, “I always want you to.”

“That means you lied to me,” he smirks.

You reply with a frown, your lips pouting as you display your confusion at his comment, whilst your fingertips continuously stroke the nape of his neck.

“You said nobody would kiss me with lips like these,” he leans towards you and murmurs tauntingly close against your mouth, his lips dancing above your own once again.

“Shut up and kiss me, H,” you whimper, hungrily stealing another kiss from him.

“Love you,” he murmurs breathlessly between kisses. “Love you — I love you, I love you,” he repeats.

With his pants becoming breathier, you fight the internal battle of wanting him to tell you how much you mean to him, and needing the actions to follow up with his sincerity, and instead you settle on your audacious remark, begging him, “So show me you love me, then.”
trail.content:
Hey everyone! This was one of my requests from the list of prompts I reblogged earlier this week. It was supposed to be a prompt but this has actually turned into an 8K bestfriend!harry one shot,  based on the angsty, “I can’t remember why I ever loved you.” Hopefully it’s enough angst but you know I can’t make Harry a complete dickhead! So we also feature fluff — like Easter chicks and bunnies, because it’s that time of year again!

Please remember that feedback is always welcomed!

Also, Happy Easter to anyone celebrating — and if you’re not celebrating, then I hope you have a lovely weekend, however you plan to spend it — and enjoy the chocolate eggs because you know, chocolate!

Cookie Monsters and Easter Bunnies.

“What the hell was that all about?” you ask incredulously, your burgundy Vans thundering heavily underneath your running legs and against the concrete as you chase after Harry into the car park of The Old Red Lion.

Visiting Harry and his family in Holmes Chapel had been a tradition for as long as you could remember when it came to birthdays, and Anne’s birthday this year had been no different. With a table booked at the local Ember Inns - an authentic pub which prides itself in serving traditional British classics, affordable wines and ales, along with it’s roaring log fires which welcome guests into the homely environment - a small gathering of family and close friends of Anne’s had been invited to join the birthday celebrations.

You had arrived in Harry’s childhood hometown a few hours prior to the event to spend some quality time with your best friend and his family. Yet, you couldn’t fathom how he had behaved so unpredictably towards you throughout the course of the evening.

“Harry, will you at least have the decency to look at me when I’m talking to you!” your voice suddenly booms into the night air as you follow closely behind the large male figure.

His footsteps instantly ease the moment you shout at him, his ears pricking up at your warning tone and his body immediately halting. Harry had never known you to shout - not at him, at least - within your years of close friendship. Slowly turning on his heel, he meets your gaze, only to be met with your teary eyes and a silence filling the space between you both.

“Well?” he eventually asks, licking his lips.

“Is that it?” you ask breathlessly, your chest heaving slightly as you shudder.

“What do you want me to say?” he asks, nonchalantly, shrugging his shoulders.

“You’ve barely spoken to me all night, H,” you tell him, sadly.

“I asked you how you are, I asked how work is for ya,” he begins, pouting his bottom lip and scuffing his shoes against the concrete of the car park that you’re undoubtedly about to have a disagreement in — because based on his attitude towards you, and you lacking the knowledge of why the sudden change in his behaviour, it’s inevitable that at least one of you is going to be left heartbroken tonight.

“Yeah, and that’s all you’ve said,” you whisper. “You haven’t spoken to me in weeks, Harry. You came back to London for a few weeks before disappearing off the face of the earth again-”

“I went to LA,” he clarifies gently.

“— and you never bothered to message me?” you ask, pulling the sleeves of your cardigan down over your thumbs before wrapping it around your shivering frame — you’re not sure if it’s a defence mechanism or if you are genuinely cold.

“My life doesn’t revolve around you!” he half yells.

“I know that,” you gulp, swallowing the lump in your throat.

“Then why are you acting as if me not contacting you is a big deal?” he asks, running his hands through his hair, tugging at the curls at the nape of his neck in frustration at how, unintentionally, disastrous the evening has played out.

“This isn’t even just about you not contacting me. You’ve been so flaky with me tonight and I don’t even know why! You’re my best friend, Harry, and you can barely string together two words and talk to me. I didn’t even hear it from you that you were back in London a few weeks ago,” you cry.

“I was busy,” he sighs, excusing his recent lack of communication.

“So I saw,” you tell him.

“What the hell is that supposed to mean?” he scoffs.

“I know you’re busy, H,” you begin, nodding your head in understanding at his situation regarding his fame, “but seeing the media posting pictures and articles of you meeting up with people, it’s hard. You mean to tell me that you couldn’t at least spare five minutes of your time to drop me a text to tell me you were home? You mean you were too busy to come and see me?”

Since arriving back home to London, Harry had been sighted in North London pubs with a string of high profile celebrities, including the CEO of Sony. You were none the wiser as to whether these well-known males in the public eye were just friends of Harry’s, or if they were involved in helping him achieve success with his upcoming album.

“Just like you couldn’t spare five minutes of your time to drop me a text and tell me you were going on a date?” he attempts to bite back, but his voice fails him as the harsh tone he strives for refuses to deliver. Instead, you’re met with his soft timbre, yet the hurt within his expression is enough to resonate into the autumn air.

“That —” you begin, struggling to form your words. The statement had caught you off guard, leaving you baffled. “This is what all of this has been about? You’re pissed off at me because I didn’t tell you I was going on a date?” you ask, the crease on your forehead becoming more prominent as you struggle to comprehend Harry’s emotions. “I would have told you in person, you know, when you were back in London, when I thought we’d actually see each other. Besides, there was nothing to tell —”

Harry’s quick to cut you off with a scoff and raised eyebrows. “Nothing to tell? Why are being so self-righteous? If I have to tell you everything that’s going on in my life, then surely you should be telling me everything you’re getting up to in yours?” he counter argues. “But instead, I find out through fans on Twitter that my best friend is hooking up with some random guy.”

You shrug your shoulders at his words, realising that perhaps he has a point. Whilst you find it devastating that you only know about Harry’s movements via social media, you hadn’t considered that maybe Harry feels equally as hurt when you don’t openly discuss things with him either. He’s your best friend, after all.

“I thought you’d have more important things to worry about,” you murmur softly.

“Like what?” he asks, awaiting your next answer.

Lowering your gaze to the ground, you gently chew your bottom lip, unsure of how to express yourself. Inhaling a deep breath, you continue, “Camille,” and your eyes squeeze shut at the sound of her name bitterly leaving your lips.

“So you’re jealous,” he states. It wasn’t a question and you both knew it.

You quickly shake your head, your heart thumping against your chest. “No, of course not.” The unwelcome taste of salt suddenly lingers on your lips and you know that the tears that had been threatening to spill over during your confrontation had done so. You only hoped Harry wouldn’t notice as you bring your hand up to rid your cheeks of the track marks they most likely left. “Why are you so bothered anyway? Why do you care who I’m dating?” you quickly attempt to change the topic of conversation.

“I’m not bothered,” he sneers. “I don’t give a shit who you’re fucking each week.”

You struggle to decipher what is being communicated, his words stabbing at your heart as he cheapens your experiences — or rather lack of — with the opposite gender. Unable to prevent your bottom lip from trembling, you let out a small sob at your best friend’s unrelenting words.

With glossy eyes and a shaky breath, you endeavour to maintain at least some dignity you may have within yourself as the conflict between the two of you persists. “What, are you jealous?” you bite back.

His disparaging smile speaks louder than words, but the remark that follows is one that resounds, “Don’t flatter yourself.” He spits his words venomously, cruelty expressed in his stance as he narrows his eyes at you.

“Fuck you,” you sob. “I’ve been there for you through everything, Harry! And this is how you repay me?” you cry. Disregarding the constant flow of tears from your red, blotchy cheeks with the back of your hand, you sigh heavily before taking a deep breath and continuing, “It’s been so hard without you being around the past few months, and I was really looking forward to seeing you tonight and spending time together. But now? I can’t remember why I ever loved you,” you whimper.

Your eyes instantly widen at your disclosure — in shock, fear, surprise, and you’re not even sure where the sudden declaration had come from. Your hidden feelings had never meant to be exposed — you dreamt most nights that you would both eventually be in a stable position in your lives where you could unselfishly confess your undying love for the boy in front of you. But this wasn’t what you had envisaged, and you hadn’t intended to overshadow Anne’s birthday celebrations. You were only too grateful that the other adults had pursued their night of revelry within the comfort of the quaint pub, none the wiser of the events occurring in Harry’s childhood village.

Perhaps the weight being lifted from deep within your heart had heightened your senses. A group of young men had drunkenly cheered, “Oi Oi,” at the revelation, a scene more common in a rom-com movie that Harry most likely owned a copy of. The smoke from their cigarettes in the designated area lingered in the October sky, and you knew that you would have to wash your hair at least twice before you no longer smell like a bonfire. Besides the jibes from the young adults loitering in the pub car park, the only other sound heard in Holmes Chapel was the eery ringing of the bells at St Luke’s Church behind you, and your heavy breathing, your hot breath forming a misty cloud before you.

“You —” Harry begins, scuffing the heel of his boot against the concrete as he places a hand on his hip, wetting his lips with his tongue, “— you love me?” he stammers.

“I —” you stutter, fingers fumbling around in your clutch bag until you find the car key you desire. Grasping it between your thumb and forefinger, you step back slightly, almost losing your balance in the process.

Harry whispers your name gently in the cold breeze, your name effortlessly rolling off his tongue as though any cruel words he had spoken prior to your revelation had diminished. “Darling?” he tries again with a pet name, his Cheshire dialect pronouncing the word you love hear him vocalise so much.

His effort at comforting you with his soft tone proves to be unsuccessful as you take advantage of the space between you and run from him, your car within only a few steps. Even under pressure and with trembling fingers, you’re able to unlock the door to the driver’s side and climb into the car, locking it behind you as you ignore Harry’s pleas, your mind blocking out the desperate call of your name whilst in pursuit of you.

“Fuck,” he mutters under his breath, running a hand through his hair as he watches you speed away from the pub — and indubitably from Holmes Chapel. He never wants you to run from him. Taking his bottom lip between his thumb and forefinger — a sign that he’s in deep thought — he’s left alone to ponder before reaching a decision that will affect his future.

* * *

Your hand firmly grips the handle of the Walt Disney Dumbo mug that houses your hot liquid as you trail up the stairs and back to your bedroom. Whilst recent events would be a satisfactory excuse to wallow, you didn’t want to waste your day off hiding underneath your duvet and pitying yourself.

Instead, you had taken to playing online games and watching ridiculously romantic movies, whilst simultaneously rearranging your iTunes folder. In other words, you were busying yourself with unnecessary and menial tasks, but it proved to be a welcomed distraction, at least.

It had been a week, a whole seven days, since you had confessed your love to Harry. As you had expected, you’d heard from him instantly upon your journey home — you’d received several messages on the same night following your declaration, requesting that you either come back to Holmes Chapel and talk things through with him, answer your phone, or at least respond to his messages so as he knows you’re safe. But since arriving back at your London home, it seemed as though Harry had given up all hope of contacting you.

Taking a sip of your hot chocolate, you inevitably smear whipped cream onto your nose, before placing the mug onto the coaster on your desk and seating yourself in the cushioned swivel chair. Tutting at the minor inconvenience, you wipe it away with the back of your hand before opening the lid to your computer and heading straight into the games section and loading your Sims family.

Beneath the cover of the chilly October skies, you took advantage of having the smallest bedroom window open onto the latch to allow fresh air to circulate the room. Your bedroom is aesthetically pleasing — the warm glow of a Yankee candle burning on your windowsill, the flickering flame reflecting against the darkness outside caused by the autumn season, and the battery powered moon phase fairy lights decorate the metal headboard of your bed, the small white lights displaying a warmth to your safe haven.

You’re so immersed in your game that a knock at the front door barely distracts you. Taking a glance at the clock, you note that whilst it’s not an unthinkable hour, you’re home alone and it’s dark outside. Only when the knocking becomes persistent do you remove yourself from the screen that’s providing you with the evening’s entertainment. You log out of your account, before sighing heavily as you trudge down the stairs.

Swinging the door open, you’re surprised as to who the uninvited guest standing in the doorway is. You blink in disbelief, before being the first to break the silence between you.

“What are you doing here, H?” you ask, wrapping your arms around your frame protectively. There’s a hint of annoyance in your voice at his unannounced visit, but sadness overpowers any other emotion that you’re internally battling as the boy who broke your heart stands before you.

“I’ve come to make amends,” he gives you a small smile, “if you’ll let me.”

You lower your gaze and chew your bottom lip gently, your eyes averting to his jewellery clad hand - his H and S Gucci rings dressing his fingers, expressing his narcissistic manner — yet you knew Harry better than anyone, and you would never describe him as a person who has excessive interest in himself.

The handle of a Tesco carrier bag is firmly within his hold and it warms your heart that even with his ever growing fame, he continues to carry out the dull task of high street shopping. “I bought cookies,” he smirks in an attempt to win you over, “with chocolate chips,” he clarifies, once he notices your gaze upon the bag he’s carrying.

You raise an eyebrow at him before frowning, pouting your lips ever so slightly. “What chocolate chips?” you dare to ask, suddenly realising that you sound like a five year old child having to be bribed by their parents to complete a household chore.

“White chocolate, ’f course,” his heart skipping a beat as a smile dances upon your lips — a smile that he had missed and desperately craved, especially after the agonisingly long week he’d experienced. “Only the best for my favourite girl.”

“I haven’t been your favourite girl for a few months now, Harry,” you murmur, your features etched with disappointment and sadness as you purse your lips together and avert your sad gaze towards the concrete step he stands on, Harry’s feet much too big for small paving slabs.

“Hey, hey doll, look at me,” his soft voice encourages you to maintain eye contact as his fingertips reach for your elbow.

The comforting action achieves it’s intention as your eyes scan his face. His boyish grin from only moments ago has disappeared and his expression is serious — apologetic. The slight tint of redness in his eyes is proof that he’s tired, perhaps having had the same amount of restless nights as you.

“You goin’ to let me in?” he pushes the conversation gently. “Because as much as I love the cold and rain, I don’t really fancy getting sick before the album release,” he smirks. “And I don’t want your cookies getting wet,” he adds, pouting his lips.

You nod, rolling your eyes, but the small smile that reappears on your lips is enough to display to Harry that you’re more than happy to have him within the comfort of your own home.

“You’re just in time, I made a hot chocolate. Do you want one?” you ask, as you step back and allow him to enter the narrow hallway of your home.

“So I can see,” he smirks, bopping your button nose with his forefinger. You mirror his expression as his playfulness displays itself, and he quickly licks the whipped cream, that he removed from the tip of your nose, off of his finger. “Silly question, really, ‘f course I’ll have one,” he laughs.

“Go on, go upstairs and I’ll bring it up,” you tell him.

Kicking off his boots and leaving them beside the front door, he quickly obliges to your request and heads upstairs, leaving you to head to the kitchen to cater for him. Whilst Harry was more than capable of looking after himself, a small part of you always felt a need to mother him.

Reaching for the mugs in the cupboard, you knowingly pull out the blue porcelain one with the famous Sesame Street Cookie Monster Muppet on it, along with the childhood classic expression, “Me want cookie! Om nom nom.” You know your sense of humour would be welcomed by him when he eats his white chocolate chip cookie whilst drinking out of the Cookie Monster mug you provide for him. Within only a few minutes, you had made the milky drink and you head upstairs with Harry’s hot chocolate.

“Here you go, cream and marshmallows, don’t say I never spoil you,” you hum softly as you enter your bedroom. You almost drop the mug at the sight of Harry sat in the padded swivel chair, exploring your online game. “Hey, that’s private!” you exclaim. You quickly place the mug down onto your wooden dresser, before reaching for the desktop mouse within Harry’s hand, removing it from his grip.

His boyish grin returns, paired with a laugh, before stating, “It’s not private if I know your password. Told ya before, lovie, you shouldn’t have the same password for everything, y’know.”

Giving you a wink, he stands from his spot, freeing the chair for you. Taking his mug of hot chocolate into his hands, he murmurs his gratitude to you before pacing to the other side of your bedroom and lowering himself onto your freshly made bed.

“We’re married, I see?” he asks rhetorically, raising an eyebrow as he nods towards your computer, referring to The Sims game you were previously playing prior to his unannounced arrival.

“We’re in the process of getting a divorce,” you murmur nonchalantly, as once again you log out of your account and focus your attention back to the young man — who seemed to make himself right at home propped up against the cushions with his legs outstretched — on your bed.

“Touché,” he replies, taking a sip of his hot liquid. “On what grounds?” he dares to ask, raising an eyebrow.

You shrug, “On the grounds that my husband accused me of fucking someone else every week,” and despite your voice being of a quiet tone, there was a hint of bitterness to your words, clearly establishing that you won’t forget some of Harry’s vicious comments in a hurry. “You can keep the kids,” you tell him. “We have two girls — they both have a very artistic side, can play the piano, and they enjoy swimming. They go to private school so are very academic. I’m keeping the dog, she’s a Golden Retriever and she’s pregnant,” you clarify. “And so am I, because we woo hoo’d a couple of weeks ago. Also, I have a date tonight,” you add, filling him in on your fantasy life.

The last comment nearly makes Harry spit the mouthful of hot chocolate out onto your crisp white bed sheets, his pulse raging, his blood boiling, and his heart thumping within his chest as he fears he may have to decipher the metaphorical terminology you’re potentially using.

He coughs, “and do you?” he asks. “I mean, do you have a date tonight?”

You shake your head. “No, not in real life,” you confirm.

Harry instantly relaxes — his chest is no longer puffed and his breathing slows once again, his once hunched over shoulders suddenly release their tension, and his ringed fingers which were momentarily curled into a fist, whilst resting on his knee, are now outstretched before him again.

The flickering light within his peripheral vision is enough to distract him from his thoughts — even if only for a short time — and his eyes avert to the window sill of your bedroom which is home to a Yankee Candle. However, with four of them in your bedroom readily available to light at any one time, he’s not sure how you make the tough decision of which scent you would like to indulge yourself in. It seemed that you were comforted by the Belgian Waffles aroma throughout the October nights, whilst Salt Mist Rose, Pink Sands, and Christmas Cookie take a back seat.

“How did —” he begins nervously, breaking the silence, “how did your date go?” he asks, placing his mug on the table beside him before leaning forwards ever so slightly at the sudden change of direction in conversation. He raises his left hand behind his head, resting the palm behind him as he subconsciously scratches the back of his head, simultaneously adjusting his right knee into an upright position.

You shrug, “I didn’t like it.”

There’s an element of worry and fear in Harry’s features, his brows furrowing, with creases appearing on the centre of his forehead. “What ‘appened? Do I need to kick his arse? Chop his bollocks off?” his British accent somewhat stronger when he curses.

You laugh at his protectiveness, surprised at how quickly you had fallen back into your accustomed routine of friendship despite recent events. “Nothing happened,” you ease his obvious anxiety with only two words. “He was a nice guy actually, we just didn’t click. It’s not my fault my heart’s not in it. Ironically, somebody else has my heart. I just tried ignoring those feels in the hope they would go away, not realising that they wouldn’t just disappear on their own,” you smile sadly, chewing your bottom lip.

Harry pouts, bringing a hand up towards his face, his thumb and forefinger make light work of his plush lips as he caresses the chapped skin that the recent cold and windy weather had been responsible for biting away at. You reach into the top drawer of your dresser, pulling out a chapstick.

“Here,” you murmur softly, standing from your spot and heading towards him. You hand him the cosmetic as you lower yourself onto your bed opposite him, cross legged as he takes the product into his larger hands and holds it at each end.

Swivelling it around within his loose grip, he reads aloud the words printed on the yellow lidded cylindrical object, “Nivea, milk and honey,” he murmurs. “Bit girly, init? Won’t do much for my masculinity,” he jokes with a small smile, but he removes the lid and applies the balm to his lips regardless.

“Well, nobody’s going to kiss you, not with lips like that,” you murmur softly as you watch him evenly spread the salve, moisturising his dry skin.

His brows continue to furrow with his intent focus on the tedious — yet simplest — task.

“You know, if you keep frowning like that, you’ll be left with worry lines,” you tell him, reaching up and delicately caressing his forehead with your soft fingertips. You immediately still at your gesture of close contact. “I’m sorry,” you breathlessly whisper, hastily removing your hand from his face and grabbing for the closest object within reach — Mr Bunny — in an attempt to put a literal barrier between the two of you.

Harry shakes his head, “Don’t apologise. I like being touched by you,” he murmurs softly. He reflects your posture, straightening his back and sitting upright, crossing his legs. Leaning forwards, he cautiously reaches for the hand you’d rapidly withdrawn from him and envelopes it within his own.

“Please, don’t. Don’t make it any harder than it already is,” you beg in a whimper at his intimate actions and affectionate words that would usually uplift your spirits and put you on cloud nine. Now, his utterances seem like empty promises and that would only threaten to break you down further, weakening the confidence you’d merely regained within the last few days.

It shatters Harry’s heart when you pull your fingers out of his hold, instead, averting your attention and caress to Mr Bunny’s long, floppy ears, your fingers twiddling with the off-white fluff of the stuffed animal sat securely within your lap.

“Didn’t I buy you this?” he asks with a small smile, his voice remarkably composed as he battled internally with the bubbling anger towards himself along with ] the hurt he was experiencing at your apparent rejection of his touch.

It was a statement as opposed to a question, Harry remembering with clarity the day he entered the Build-a-Bear Workshop in the shopping mall as it fast approached Easter only a year ago. He had chosen the bunny rabbit solitarily, shamelessly stuffing him — with love, quite literally, as the floor manager handed him a heart shape and requested he press a kiss to it before fitting it within the teddy — before printing off a birth certificate and choosing a wrist accessory — an Easter flower bouquet consisting of three coloured roses — pink, yellow, and purple.

“Yeah,” you laugh breathily, as he removes the soft toy from your lap and inspects it. “You know, most people buy their friend’s Easter eggs that time of year,” you smile up at him, meeting his gaze since the first time you’d willingly expressed your endearment towards him with the tender touch of your fingertips.

‘I did get you an Easter egg,” he cockily states with a smirk, simultaneously shrugging his shoulders whilst his hands cordially stroke the ears of the bunny now sat in his lap. “A Crunchie one, if I remember correctly,” he grins knowingly.

“You did get me a Crunchie one, but you bought me the teddy, too,” you state matter of factly, attempting to prove the point of his need to go excessively overboard regarding buying gifts for his loved ones for an array of occasions that he could find any reason to celebrate.

“It’s a rabbit,” he informs you.

“Same thing,” you dismiss.

“They’re actually not,” he mumbles softly. “Anyway, it was the flower bouquet as an accessory that made your smile burst into full bloom,” he beams, his boyish grin returning once again as he teases you. “You do love your teddies,” he notes, as he looks around your childhood bedroom.

Harry sought great comfort in the ordinary bedroom you possessed throughout your childhood. He had watched both you, and your living environment, mature with time.
